thread.title: West Ham 0-4 Manchester City player ratings as Leroy Sane, Yaya Toure, Gabriel Jesus and David Silva scored
thread.title_full: West Ham 0-4 Manchester City player ratings as Leroy Sane, Yaya Toure, Gabriel Jesus and David Silva scored

author: John Cross
title: West Ham 0-4 Manchester City player ratings as Leroy Sane, Yaya Toure, Gabriel Jesus and David Silva scored
text:
Yaya Toure of Manchester City celebrates scoring his team's fourth goal (Photo: Getty) Share Get football   
Gabriel Jesus scored on his full Premier League debut as Manchester City mauled West Ham 4-0. 
Sergio Aguero watched from the bench as the £27million teenager marked a sparkling display by setting up Kevin De Bruyne's opener and then bagging one himself. 
David Silva was also on target in a one-sided first half, while Yaya Toure piled on the misery for the hosts with a penalty after the break. 
Another routine win at the London Stadium boosted City's top-four challenge after Chelsea, Liverpool, Tottenham and Arsenal all dropped points 24 hours earlier. 
But they were helped by some woeful defending from West Ham, who have shipped 12 goals in three meetings with Pep Guardiola's side this season. 
Our man John Cross was at the game, here are his player ratings... Manchester City's Kevin De Bruyne celebrates scoring their first goal (Photo: AFP) West Ham 
Pretty thankless task, not at fault, but West Ham could still improve on him. 
Byram - 5 
Nutmegged by Sane on the second goal and is still cashing shadows. 
Reid - 5 
Saw West Ham’s defence fall apart all around him. It was a devastating night. 
Fonte - 4 
Had a nightmare debut. Outmuscled on one goal, conceded a penalty for another. David Silva of Manchester City scores his team's second goal (Photo: Getty) 
Cresswell - 4 
Gave the ball away horribly before first goal. Hasn’t been good under Bilic. 
Obiang - 4 
Gave the ball away horribly to Sane for the third goal. He was awful. 
Noble - 5 
Tried to set an early tone with some crunching tackles, can’t fault his commitment. 
Antonio - 5 
Struggled to get into the game and make a real impact. Poor. 
Lanzini - 5 
Booked. He is supposed to be Payet’s successor. Not on this evidence. Manchester City's Gabriel Jesus scores their third goal (Photo: REUTERS) 
Feghouli - 4 
Frustrating at times, you can see the potential, but is very inconsistent. 
Carroll - 6 
Brilliant ball to send Cresswell clear, his presence always troubles opponents. 
Substitutes 
Fernandes, for Feghouli, 64 mins, 5. 
Snodgrass, for Obiang, 64 mins, 6. 
Fletcher, for Carroll, 80 mins, 6. Manchester City's Yaya Toure scores his team's fourth goal from the penalty spot (Photo: AFP) Man City 
Long overdue chance ahead of Bravo. Gives defenders more confidence. 
Sagna - 7 
Always solid and determined at right back. Kept West Ham quiet. 
Stones - 7 
Made an incredibly brave block, put his head in where it hurts to stop Reid. 
Otamendi - 7 
Still looks a weak link at times as West Ham were dangerous on occasion. 
Kolarov - 7 
Had a comfortable night because West Ham were so bad. Easy street. 
Toure - 8 
Imposing figure in City’s midfield. Can boss the game with his authority and vision. Sane goes past Mark Noble and Winston Reid (Photo: AFP) 
De Bruyne - 8 
Fabulous counter attack and finish on the opening goal. Central role suits him. 
Sane - 9 
Brilliant run and assist to set up the second goal. Now we’re seeing his potential. 
Silva - 8 
Nice finish at the back post capped another typical classy midfield display. Read More
